Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water, showing how it appears healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water, showing how it might appear withered or unhealthy.
The student can illustrate the difference between a plant with water and without water by showing changes in the leaves or overall plant structure.
The student can include a sun in their drawing to indicate that plants also need light in addition to water to live and grow.
The student can demonstrate their understanding that plants need both water and light by drawing two side-by-side comparisons: one with water and light, and one without water.
